fields.value: Race of Prisoners Admitted to State and Federal Institutions in the United States, 1926-1986

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

authorAffiliation.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection includes tabulations of annual adult  admissions to federal and state correctional institutions by  race. Data are provided for the years 1926 to 1986 and include  tabulations for prisons in each of the 50 states and the District of  Columbia, as well as federal prison totals and United States  totals. The figures were derived from a voluntary reporting program in  which each state, the District of Columbia, and the Federal Bureau of  Prisons reported summary and detailed statistics as a part of the  National Prisoner Statistics series. Individual state and United  States population figures according to racial categories also are provided.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

fields.value: Version Date: 1999-10-04Version Text: 1999-10-04Version Date: 1999-10-04Version Text: 1999-10-04 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: The SPSS data definition statements were updated  and SAS data definition statements were created for this  collection. Also, Appendix A of the codebook was scanned and the entire codebook was converted to PDF.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: OSIRIS and Card Image, with SAS and SPSS data definition statements for each;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) The 54 cases in this collection represent the 50  states and the District of Columbia plus three additional categories,  United States totals, federal totals, and state totals. The United  States totals are the sum of the federal and state categories. (2) The  codebook is provided as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF  file format was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be  accessed using PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat  Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the Internet.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
